form.name: form1

div.span: Schools Closed for the Remainder of 2019-2020 School Year

span.p:
Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that all schools in the State of Ohio will be closed through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
District updates during this time can be found HERE. Online Learning will continue for the remainder of the school year.

div.span: Meeting Dates, Minutes, Watch Meetings Online & More
All facilities plan updates can be found here

div.h3: Follow the District on Social Media
div.span: Daily updates on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube
Stay informed with the District Newsletters

span.br: The Board will forego an in-person meeting on Tuesday, April 28 to avoid a gathering of our board, staff and community members and will instead conduct this meeting by video conference using Zoom. The public is invited to join the conference. Link in the artice.

img.title: Levy Renewal
img.alt: Renewal Levy - Issue 2 - ABSENTEE VOTING EXTENDED THROUGH APRIL 28

div.h3: Renewal Levy - Issue 2 - ABSENTEE VOTING EXTENDED THROUGH APRIL 28

span.br: The 2020 Ohio Primary Election originally scheduled for March 17, 2020 will now be conducted by absentee ballot through April 28. The Riverside Local School District is part of the Lake County School Financing District Renewal Levy (Issue 2) that will appear on the Primary Election ballot. Because this is a renewal levy, there will be NO TAX INCREASE for residents.

img.title: Student Registration
img.alt: Kindergarten & New Student Online Registration for 2020-2021

div.h3: Kindergarten & New Student Online Registration for 2020-2021

span.br: If you are new to the Riverside Local School District, or have children entering kindergarten, you must register your children to the District online for the 2020-2021 school year starting Monday, May 4, 2020.

img.title: Online
img.alt: Online and Distance Learning Instructions * UPDATED APRIL 20

div.h3: Online and Distance Learning Instructions * UPDATED APRIL 20

span.br: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that the state ordered school closure will now go through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. The next phase of Online and Distance Learning will begin on Tuesday, April 14. Click 'Read More' for detailed instructions to guide you through this process.

Staff members across the District wanted to share positive messages with students and families while they are away from school. We hope this video brings you and your family comfort during this difficult time.

img.title: Wash hands
img.alt: How to Properly Wash Your Hands

div.h3: How to Properly Wash Your Hands
div.span: Here are six steps to ensure that we are properly washing our hands with soap.

img.title: Logo
img.alt: COVID-19 Running Updates - Schools closed remainder of 19-20 school year

div.h3: COVID-19 Running Updates - Schools closed remainder of 19-20 school year

span.br:
Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that the state ordered school closure will now go through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Online Learning will continue for the remainder of the school year.
For running updates about how the Riverside Local School District is operating during the COVID-19 crisis, click 'Read More'

br.span: If you experience any technical issues with your Chromebook device during this Online Instruction period, we have put the following protocols in place to help assist you during this time.

img.title: Meal Logo
img.alt: Meal Services During Closure * Updated April 7

div.h3: Meal Services During Closure * Updated April 7

span.br: Beginning Monday, March 30, the Riverside Local School District will be providing students with breakfast and lunch meals on Mondays and Wednesdays throughout the duration of the state ordered school closure. Meals will be packaged for multiple days.

img.title: Internet
img.alt: Options for Families with No Internet

div.h3: Options for Families with No Internet

span.br: We understand that not all families in the District have access to the internet. This article outlines some options that your family can explore during this extended state-ordered school closure. Please share with any families you know who do not have the internet.

Given these uncertain times, the District want you to know that the school counselors will be available to answer questions throughout the time that we are away from school. This article also includes coping strategies and tips to reduce stress and anxiety during this crisis.
